programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: After 15 years of saving and planning, Fred and Saffron Baker start work on their innovative new family home on a 30 degree slope. Kevin McCloud visits the Peak District as they build into the thick Derbyshire limestone.

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.desc: In 1980, Michael Parkinson interviewed Sir Robert Helpmann in an extensive one on one chat.

More Optus customers say they couldnt contact emergency services, months before the recent outages. Sarah Ferguson interviews Papua New Guineas Prime Minister James Marape after the signing of a historic defence treaty.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: The government shutdown turns into a showdown over healthcare. Also, Trump advances plans to send troops into another American city, while the military destroys another drug-smuggling boat off the coast of Venezuela.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: Parliament resumes after a one month break. Coverage of Question Time from the House of Representatives, while the Senate has Budget Estimates.

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.sub-title: Behani, Tom Cardy, Brian Mannix and Michala Banas
programme.desc: This week theres a lot to dig - Behani teaches Adam, Myf and Alan the Persian Snap, Tom Cardy dances to PSY, Brian Mannix regales with Countdown stories and Michala Banas tries to reach an invisible top shelf.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: News from where we live. ABC News NSW brings you the days top stories, exclusive investigations and original reporting on the issues that matter to you. Presented by Nakari Thorpe, plus weather with Tom Saunders.

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: Black Saturday Bushfires. Sunday 7 February 2009. I Was Actually There collects personal stories from survivors, first responders and community members who faced the catastrophe.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: Online bookmakers have kept millions in wagers placed with stolen money. Why has the federal government failed to respond to a cross parliamentary blueprint for reform and what will it take to curb the harms of gambling?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Joe and Lina take on the London property market, as they build their own home on a tiny 38 square metre plot. Theyll need to cleverly maximise the space, but the project soon runs months behind schedule and over budget.

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.sub-title: 1980: Dr Joseph Braysich, Peter Allen, Faith Bandler
programme.desc: In 1980 Michael Parkinson was joined by guests Dr Joseph Braysich, Peter Allen and Faith Bandler.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Pilgrimage: The Road Through The Alps
programme.desc: The pilgrims take a cable car from St Anton am Arlberg to just over 2000m for a 5km walk. Later, they stop off at Sennhutte to learn about the story of edelweiss, Austrias national flower.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Kerry Stokes quits, amid planned merge with Southern Cross Media. Worried about misinformation? Youre the problem, according to tech overlords. Kidman and Urbans divorce hasnt stopped press from going into overdrive.

programme.title: Anhs Brush With Fame
programme.desc: French chef Manu Feildels passion for entertaining has made him a regular on our TV screens over the last decade. Anh captures the desire, determination and flair of a man who has worked hard for every opportunity.

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.sub-title: Gillian Cosgriff, Jenny Tian, Phil Jamieson and Tom Ballard
programme.desc: Adam, Myf and Alan join Gillian Cosgriff, Jenny Tian, Phil Jamieson and Tom Ballard as they find out why Stephen Kings wife threatened to leave him and what Andrew Lloyd Webber really thought of Cats The Movie.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: News from where we live. ABC News NSW brings you the days top stories, exclusive investigations and original reporting on the issues that matter to you. Presented by Nakari Thorpe, plus weather with Tom Saunders.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Four contestants, one Big Brass Mug, and a host who takes no prisoners. Tom Gleeson tests his charges on their expert topics of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, the guillotine, the human circulatory system, and Olympic Swimming.

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Renowned interviewer, Leigh Sales mentors Autistic journalism students in The Assembly, and in this episode, the students interview journalist Ray Martin, with heart-warming results.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: With the help of opera singer Lucy OBryne, the Doctors reveal the hidden muscle that makes you breathe, Dr Xand heads to a DNA laboratory to solve the mystery of who stole his strawberry milk.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: After Panda gets injured on the basketball court, the Bears invite Charlie to be on their basketball team. But when Charlie gets too good, he starts to ruin all the fun of the game.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: When Chloe gets akumatized into Queen Banana, Ladybug decides to entrust a Miraculous to a new and promising ally to help her stop the supervillain.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When a strange space craft crash-lands on the farm, Shaun and co help its little green occupant get air-borne again.

programme.title: Expedition With Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve joins forces with shark scientist Mauricio Hoyos to dive a remote volcanic island in the Eastern Pacific. Their goal is to discover where shark mothers give birth and help protect a new generation of these ocean giants.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Gamers In The Wild: Physical Gamers and Floor Plan 2
programme.desc: We continue our look into the wide world of gamers with the sweaty life of the Physical Gamer, plus we check out the silly virtual reality puzzles of Floor Plan 2!

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: When the bears find a box full of free stuff at a yard sale, they go on their own adventures.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Marinette sneaks into the Agreste home during a private dinner, only to find out that a supervillain is also crashing the party. Will Ladybug save the day, or rather, the soiree?

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Oscar accidentally turns himself into a couch.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer decides to get a robotic sheep-dog, but when it turns out to be even stricter than Bitzer, Shaun decides it has to go.

programme.title: Fresh Off The Boat
programme.desc: Louis prides himself on being a fun dad, but after he is forced stay home with the boys, he scrambles to find ways to entertain them. At Cattlemans Ranch, Jessica struggles to manage the staff and the new takeout service.

programme.title: Merlin
programme.desc: Merlin is forced to choose between a young Druids life and his destiny to protect Arthur.

programme.title: Officially Amazing Goes Bunkers
programme.desc: From towering dice and dangling acrobats to dizzying car stunts and ice skating leaps, this is a show packed full of daring and fun.

programme.title: Changing Ends
programme.desc: Christine forces a stressed-out Graham into going on a caravan mini-break. Whilst not the holiday of their dreams, Alan manages to find a like-minded friend who really gets him.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Addie bravely presents her memorial idea to the old-fashioned village council and in 16th century Juniper Maggie stands up to a fearsome witch-hunter.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Goku Makes An Entrance At Last! A Last Chance From Lord Beerus!
programme.desc: With a new surge of power, Vegeta attacks Beerus! But it isnt enough. Giving Earth a second chance, Beerus challenges Oolong to rock-paper-scissors. Will Goku arrive in time to help his friends and planet?

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Que hates seeing Helsing and Monster Head fight and thinks she has the perfect solution - what if Monster Head had a body?

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Concert Catastrophe
programme.desc: Maudie is crushed when her tickets to a pop concert go missing, especially since it seems likely that she herself has misplaced them.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: While visiting the lake, Buttercup vows to capture a legendary uncatchable crawdad.

programme.title: Austin
programme.desc: Julian is concerned when Austin turns his phone off and leaves the house to have some time on his own. In a boutique gallery in outer London Ingrid prepares for an exhibition of her artwork. (Final)

programme.title: rage New Country Special
programme.desc: rage lines up the best clips from the new generation of country music-megastars including Shaboozey, Morgan Wallen, Jellyroll, Luke Combs, Lainey Wilson and more.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Addie and Audreys friendship blossoms as they go door to door to spread the word about Junipers witches. Maggie starts a secret rebellion putting her at odds with Elinor.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Thanks For Waiting Lord Beerus! A Super Saiyan God Is Born At Last
programme.desc: Summoning Shenron, they learn what the Super Saiyan God is. Rather than a particular person, it is a kindhearted Saiyan who can become one. But transforming into one requires more Saiyans than they have on board.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Pierce accidentally erases his memory and forgets who he is! Now acting like the school bad boy, Charlie and Que have to refresh his memory.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Soccer Saga
programme.desc: Kyle asks Maudie and Ava to make a video of his soccer match but Maudie discovers something about the game is not quite right.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Morbucks throws the biggest birthday party of all time, and Blossom is the only one not invited.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George meets Ollie who wants to transform a double-decker coach into a Japanese-style pod hotel, and a man who built his daughters home in his garden for just 12,000 pounds. Georges own garden build starts to take shape.

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: When a second victim is linked to the case the team are now confronted with the possibility of a double murder. Jess and Sunny must now decipher which of the suspects are telling the truth. (Final)

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: A camera crew interviews the staff for a documentary on emergency medicine. Morris cop girlfriend is rushed into the ER with gunshot wounds. Carters illness overtakes him during a critical procedure in a trauma room.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Colly Wobble likes to do things differently, when Colly Wobbles friends see how much she enjoys driving her car backwards, they decide to go backwards too. So Colly Wobble drives her car forwards - just to be different.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: A big wind comes to Mollyvale and its time for the annual kite-flying festival. The villagers take their kites to the skies which Pop takes a little too literally ending up stuck in a tree. Luckily it is Beep to the rescue.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: It is the Lantern Festival and Bop needs help to make the lanterns. If Zap helps Bop make lanterns, who will do his deliveries? If Mimi does deliveries who will make the dumplings? Soon everyone in town has traded places.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector and Mole discover to the musical sounds of a rockpool on the beach.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Coco discovers Bings dressing up box so they both dress up. Coco is Princess Cococapono and Bing is, of course, King Bing. But there is only one crown and both need it to complete their outfits.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas car runs out of petrol but thankfully Granddad Dogs garage isnt far away. With one phone call, Granddad Dog is on his way and tows Peppas car back to his garage.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer wants a family photo and instructs Bitzer to gather all the animals together. Getting them all to stand still at the same time is more than they can manage and Shaun discovers hes cut out of the shot!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: James hopes his dads massive binoculars will help spot a rare seal, but they cause him to topple overboard instead!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle wants bread for his Royal breakfast, but there isnt any flour in the castle. Mr Elf takes Holly, Ben and Nanny Plum to the Elf Windmill to find out why it takes so long to make flour.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas pet goldfish Goldie is having a birthday party with an undersea theme.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma is inspired by Wanda and Big Trevs synchronised swimming routines and pushes herself to learn it.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.sub-title: An Ogre Wedding in Pitchfork Pines
programme.desc: Luigis true self and love are celebrated as the Super Monsters create a magical outdoor wedding for him and his fiance.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Monster Camp
programme.desc: When Jay discovers Nikhil had camped in the wild, he wants to have a monster camping adventure in their garden. Will they meet any monsters? And will Jay be as brave as Nikhil?

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie makes a time capsule by collecting items that represent the important things to him: family, friends, and, of course, space.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can a boat still move without a motor or sail? Luke is putting it to the test in the Science Time Lab, making a paddle boat with household items to propel through the water!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Simon and Caterina are in Wiggly Kitchen looking for snacks for their trip to the beach, while looking they come across a beautiful seashell. There is a mystery in Wiggle Town, who could it belong to?

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Roll up, roll up to see I, G and H in a thrilling high-wire circus act! This episode introduces the IGH letter team and the words tight, net, tent, high, light, night, right and fright.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Suzy and Peppa start a Secret Club - going on secret missions, and doing secret things. In secret. But soon everyone wants to join!

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Millie builds a little lending library for her friends and her community.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Myrtle is locked in her tower and Stanley needs to get her out.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma is inspired by Wanda and Big Trevs synchronised swimming routines and pushes herself to learn it.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When a pretend emergency turns into a real emergency, theres only one engine who can save the day!

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa and the junior gardeners make a seethrough worm farm to see what goes on beneath the soil with their wriggly friends.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Its time to Wiggle and Learn and Get Ready for Bed with The Wiggles! From a lovely bath to brushing your teeth, join Caterina and Dorothy as they take us through a peaceful bedtime routine.

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Lucia makes too many plans.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle brings lots of musical instruments into playgroup for the children - instruments that go shake, rattle and bang!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: Pearl investigates when excess water flows down a mountain, washing away food supplies. She finds a unique pink glacier that triggers a pika rescue, an algae feast, and a water stoppage.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo run a crazy "Hotel" with Dad as their put upon guest. But when Bingo quits over Bluey being too controlling, Dad needs to teach them the importance of compromise.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Its a lovely warm day for the beach. The squirrels learn how to make sand castles. They are doing such a good job that Jon and Nigel the crabs ask if the squirrels could work together to build them a new home.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea tricks Supertato into believing that he has no superpowers without his red cape. When he rescues his friends without it, he discovers that he has superpowers - cape or no cape!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad refuses to be late dropping off Bluey and Bingo at kindy and school, but the girls make Dad play so many games, they quickly derail his plan.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: When Mr Onion wishes he could be a merry king like Old King Cole, all of his friends work together to make Old King Onion the merriest king of all.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Beep learns about missing something and introduces the villagers to Planet Beep, shedding light on her life before she landed in Mollyvale.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Bop wants to see a real dinosaur so he decides to look for one in the town square. He is disappointed he cant find a single one so his friends come up with a clever plan to help Bop see a dinosaur.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector finds a cello, which makes a lot of different sounds. But whose is it?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing makes Sula a picture with all her favourite things on it. It just needs one last jewel stuck on but oops the glue spills all over the picture. Sparkles save the day.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig and Daddy Pig are taking Peppa and George to play in the playground. On the way it gets a bit foggy, and soon it is so foggy they cant see. They decide to go home. But which way is home?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its a scorching hot day on the farm and the Flock need to cool off. When Bitzer discovers the Sheep Dip is out of action the Flock have to come up with another plan.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When the banks of the Pontypandy River burst, Mandy and Norman go on an adventure to rescue their wildlife journal a... sandwiches?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Snobby King and Queen Marigold are coming to visit the Little Kingdom, and Holly and her Mummy and Daddy enlist the Elf Band to impress them.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends are at the playground, Mr Bull builds a Club House for Peppa and her friends. It is a lovely Club House with a slide on the side.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When Neville thinks he sees a mermaid in the lagoon, he sets out to find her.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Cleo and Spike learn that curiosity and honesty can turn questions into adventures.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Missing Appalams
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay are detectives today. When the homemade appalams go missing under their watch, they need to solve the case and save lunch!

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie does his morning routine on the first day of school after a lovely break.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Why do objects sink or float? Dive on in with Rachael eggs-perimenting with water density using eggs, salt and water. Turn your egg into a sea turtle and see if it will sink or float!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Captain Feathersword and Lachy find a train ticket in the Wiggly Kitchen, what do you do with a train ticket? Sing along to Pufferbillies; toot toot, off we go, then the Tree of Wisdom is here to help!

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: M is hungry, but his new friend the toad is even hungrier. Can he stop it eating everything? This episode introduces the OA letter team and the words toad, coat, coal, goal, goat, moat, loaf and toast.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle brings lots of musical instruments into playgroup for the children - instruments that go shake, rattle and bang!

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Millie struggles to get Wallace to sit still, after deciding to enter his photo in a contest.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley gives the town hall a new paint job as per Myrtles request.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When Neville thinks he sees a mermaid in the lagoon, he sets out to find her.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas pushes Shankar into entering the Fancy Costume Contest even though Shankar doesnt want the spotlight on him.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Its mission time! Clarence and the junior gardeners get their magnifying glasses out to investigate all the different types of dirt in the garden. But will they crack this muddy case?!

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Celebrate with The Wiggles as they look back on some of their favourite memories! From holidays to parties, to even a great plate of jelly, its the Best of Wiggle and Learn!

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Ariel finds a lost dogfish.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa tries to prove to Suzy Sheep that she is not a chatterbox, but staying quiet is harder than it sounds.

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: When a Cold Snap hits the Everglades, Ranger Marsh has to call in the Octonauts for backup to help all the creatures who dont know how to handle the cold.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: At the park, Bluey is struggling to learn how to ride her bike. But as she and Dad watch her friends determination with their own tasks, Bluey is inspired to give it another try.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee and the Squirrels decide to play football. The Squirrels dont know what to do as theyve never played football before. Worm, Hennie and Ethel do their best to show them the rules.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea traps Supertato and demands he tell her the secret of his superstrength. Supertato escapes and tells Evil Pea that his friends give him his strength.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Bluey has a playdate at Chloes, Bingo must learn how to play by herself. But all the games she knows need more than one person! Luckily Dad has a problem that needs solving.

programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Craig Smart in Perth.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Thousands of scans under urgent review after a patient with advanced cancer died following a bungle at a Queensland hospital, a campaign to make sheep shearing an Olympic sport, and the outback rescue of a cheeky sausage dog.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Get a head start on the week. Chas and John break down the latest from the US, as Donald Trump tests the limits of Presidential power using Executive Orders, tariffs, government agencies and the Courts to try and get his way.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Ros Childs brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Johnson Raela presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: Online bookmakers have kept millions in wagers placed with stolen money. Why has the federal government failed to respond to a cross parliamentary blueprint for reform and what will it take to curb the harms of gambling?
